title: BMP-1
summary: The BMP-1 is a Soviet amphibious tracked infantry fighting vehicle. BMP stands for Boyevaya Mashina Pjehoty 1 (Russian: Боевая Машина Пехоты 1; БМП-1), meaning "infantry fighting vehicle, 1st serial model".[11] The BMP-1 was the first mass-produced infantry fighting vehicle (IFV) of the Soviet Union.[8][12] It was called the M-1967, BMP and BMP-76PB by NATO before its correct designation was known.[13][14]
